briefTitle: Evaluation of the Fluoride Dose Response of a Modified In Situ Caries Model
officialTitle: Evaluation of the Fluoride Dose Response of a Modified In Situ Caries Model

interventions.name: 0 ppm F (placebo, negative control)
otherNames: Sensodyne sodium fluoride/silica toothpaste base formulation

interventions.name: 250 ppm F as NaF (dose-response control)
otherNames: Sensodyne sodium fluoride/silica toothpaste base formulation

interventions.name: 500 ppm F as NaF (dose-response control)
otherNames: Sensodyne sodium fluoride/silica toothpaste base formulation

interventions.name: 1100 ppm F as NaF (positive control)
otherNames: Sensodyne sodium fluoride/silica toothpaste base formulation

summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the fluoride dose response of different dentifrice fluoride concentrations - 0, 250, 500 and 1100 ppm fluoride of our existing in situ model involving the use of human enamel specimens placed in the buccal flange area of the subjects partial denture with the modified model involving placement of bovine enamel specimens in a denture tooth location.

primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Enamel specimens will be evaluated after 14 days of intra-oral exposure
